1.text: Hear the word of the LORD, ye children of Israel: for the LORD hath a controversy with the inhabitants of the land, because there is no truth, nor mercy, nor knowledge of God in the land.

2.text: By swearing, and lying, and killing, and stealing, and committing adultery, they break out, and blood toucheth blood.

3.text: Therefore shall the land mourn, and every one that dwelleth in it shall languish, with the beasts of the field, and with the fowls of heaven; yes, the fishes of the sea also shall be taken away.

4.text: Yet let no man contend, nor reprove another: for thy people are as they that contend with the priest.

5.text: Therefore shalt thou fall in the day, and the prophet also shall fall with thee in the night, and I will destroy thy mother.

6.text: My people are destroyed for lack of knowledge: because thou hast rejected knowledge, I will also reject thee, that thou shalt be no priest to me: seeing thou hast forgotten the law of thy God, I will also forget thy children.

7.text: As they were increased, so they sinned against me: therefore will I change their glory into shame.

8.text: They eat up the sin of my people, and they set their heart on their iniquity.

9.text: And there shall be, like people, like priest: and I will punish them for their ways, and reward them their doings.

10.text: For they shall eat, and not have enough: they shall be guilty of lewdness, and shall not increase: because they have ceased to take heed to the LORD.

11.text: Lewdness and wine and new wine take away the heart.

12.text: My people ask counsel at their stocks, and their staff declareth to them: for the spirit of lewdness hath caused them to err, and they have gone astray from under their God.

13.text: They sacrifice upon the tops of the mountains, and burn incense upon the hills, under oaks and poplars and elms, because the shade of them is agreeable: therefore your daughters shall be guilty of lewdness, and your spouses shall commit adultery.

14.text: I will not punish your daughters when they are guilty of lewdness, nor your spouses when they commit adultery: for they themselves are separated with prostitutes, and they sacrifice with harlots: therefore the people that doth not understand shall fall.

15.text: Though thou, Israel, playest the harlot, yet let not Judah offend; and come not ye to Gilgal, neither go ye up to Beth-aven, nor swear, The LORD liveth.

16.text: For Israel slideth back as a backsliding heifer: now the LORD will feed them as a lamb in a large place.

17.text: Ephraim is joined to idols: let him alone.

18.text: Their drink is sour: they have been guilty of lewd deeds continually: her rulers with shame do love, Give ye.

19.text: The wind hath bound her up in her wings, and they shall be ashamed because of their sacrifices.
